instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 no backlight
threads.message:
I know no backlight....

I watched a few videos and have learned some but I cannot get this board to give me backlight.

Replaced Q7706 and U7701 and nothing.

BLK_PWM is 0.509v even after replacing U7701

threads.title: 820-00165 no backlight
threads.message:
BKL_PWM controls U7701, not viceversa!
Post BKL_EN level too.

We need more info to help.
Post voltage and diode mode to ground on both pins of D7701.
Be aware of XW7720; pictures can be found on the forum.
Do you get image at least (on internal LCD)?
External video OK?

threads.title: 820-00165 no backlight
threads.message:
BKL_EN 2.8v
D7701 8.59v both legs
D7701 586 on the left and 408 on the right
XW7720 looks almost gone, a little better than this one [url]https://drive.google.com/file/d/18UR9ufMnaWRTbwZwNjTTxmIcHGCNpSBl/view[/url] but damaged, so I ran a jumper from what was left of that pad to D7701 and also checked continuity from there to pin 5 of U7701, but still nothing 
Yes I see the folder question mark when I light the LCD from the back, did not check external video, but I assume is fine.

threads.title: 820-00165 no backlight
threads.message: Not sure if you get a notification when I reply as a comment, let me know.

threads.title: 820-00165 no backlight
threads.message: No we do not. Please only reply. Let me be more clear. Post voltage on  C7797. If 8.59 volts, then something wrong with feedback/the LED driver.

threads.title: 820-00165 no backlight
threads.message:
If you've changed U7701, post now diode mode (red probe at ground) on all return resistors.

Do PRAM reset few times.
If BKL_PWM still low, then remove R7704 and run a wire from R7715 to C7704.
Check if backlight comes on.

threads.title: 820-00165 no backlight
threads.message:
[USER="1153"]JohnB8812[/USER] C7797 indeed is 8.56v 

[USER="682"]2informaticos[/USER] all return resistors measure 0.630
R7704 is 0.504v
I ran a wire from R7715 to C7704 after removing R7704 and no backlight either, folder with question mark flashes when I use a flash-light but no backlight yet.

threads.title: 820-00165 no backlight
threads.message: Did you try known good compatible LCD assembly?

threads.title: 820-00165 no backlight
threads.message:
Yes, good know compatible LCD.

I put a new LP8550 and all is working again, thanks [USER="682"]2informaticos[/USER]  and [USER="1153"]JohnB8812[/USER] for all the help.
